subFiles.fileContent:
# Oskari.statistics.statsgrid.ClassificationService

Used to classifify data. Limits as to how the classification can be done are found in an limits-property of the service:

```javascript
limits : {
    count : {
        min : 2,
        max : 9,
        def : 5
    },
    method : ['jenks', 'quantile', 'equal'],
    mode : ['distinct', 'discontinuous']
}
```

## Functions

### getClassification(indicatorData, options)

Classifies given dataset. Expects data as object like:
 {
	key1 : 1,
	key2 : 3,
	key3 : 2
 }

Options can include:
  {
     count : <number between 2-9 - defaults to 5>,
     method : <one of 'jenks', 'quantile', 'equal' - defaults to 'jenks'>,
     mode : <one of 'distinct', 'discontinuous' - defaults to 'distinct'>,
     precission : <undefined or integer between 0-20 - defaults to undefined>
  }


Returns an object like:
 {
      bounds : [<classification bounds as numbers like [0,2,5,6]>],
      ranges : [<classification ranges as strings ["0-2", "2-5", "5-6"]>],
      stats : {
          min : <min value in data>,
          max : <max value in data>,
          ...
          mean : <mean value in data>
      },
      getGroups : <function to return keys in data grouped by value ranges, takes an optional param index to get just one group>,
      getIndex : <function to return a group index for data - TODO: is this needed since we have getGroups?>,
      createLegend : <function to create html-legend for ranges, takes colorset and optional title as params>
  }

```javascript
var data = {
	key1 : 1,
	key2 : 3,
	key3 : 2
 };
var result = service.getClassification(data, {count : 2});

var groups = result.getGroups(); // returns [[key1, key3], [key2]]
var firstGroup = result.getGroups(0) // returns [key1, key3]
var theseMatch = groups[0] === firstGroup; // true

// using the index, we can get group of keys in the same classification group
var groupIndexForKey2 = result.getIndex(data[key2]) // returns 1
var groupWithKey2 = result.getGroups(groupIndexForKey2) -> returns [key2]
var theseMatchAlso = groups[groupIndexForKey2] === groupWithKey2; // true
```

# Oskari.statistics.statsgrid.StateService

Used to set and store the state of the statsgrid functionality. Sends out events when the state is changed: indicator added/removed, regionset changed, region selected or active indicator changed.

# Oskari.statistics.statsgrid.StatisticsService

Used to fetch statistics data from the server.

event.name: StatsGrid.ActiveIndicatorChangedEvent
event.desc:
Notifies when an indicator has been selected (in grid etc).
Components handling indicators should update a "highlighted" indicator where needed.

event.name: StatsGrid.ClassificationChangedEvent
event.desc: Notifies when an classification has been changed (in edit classification).

event.name: StatsGrid.DatasourceEvent
event.desc: Notifies that a datasource has more indicators available (or indicators have been removed).

event.name: StatsGrid.IndicatorEvent
event.desc: Used to notify that an indicator has been added to or removed from selected indicators.

event.name: StatsGrid.RegionSelectedEvent
event.desc:
Used to notify that a region has been selected in statsgrid.
Components handling regions can update "highlighted" regions or the latest selection.

event.name: StatsGrid.RegionsetChangedEvent
event.desc: Notifies regionset change

divmanazer.name: divmanazer

subFiles.fileContent:
# Badge

## Description

A stylized element for showing values.

## Usage

```javascript
    var badge = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.Badge');
    badge.insertTo( someElement );
    badge.setContent( someValue, "oskari" );
```
The second parameter in badge.setContent() is the style param.
i.e.
## Screenshot

![screenshot](badge.png)

# Button ## Description The button component is defined in divmanazer bundle and provides a generic button ui element. ## Screenshot ![screenshot](button.png) ## How to use Creates a button with label "Alert" and binds a handler to it that shows an alert when clicked. `addClass('primary')` makes it visually a "primary" button (colored blue). ```javascript var alertBtn = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.Button'); alertBtn.addClass('primary'); alertBtn.setTitle('Alert'); alertBtn.setHandler(function() { alert('Alert'); }); ``` Inserts the button to given element. ```javascript var myUI = jQuery('div.mybundle.buttons'); alertBtn.insertTo(myUI); ``` Removes the button. ```javascript alertBtn.destroy(); ``` ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked on the page Used to create the component UI from begin to end

# ColorSelect ## Description The color select component is defined in divmanazer bundle and provides a generic color select ui element. ## Screenshot ![screenshot](colorselect.png) ## How to use Creates a color selection. Three first are single colors and then use many colors. ```javascript var colorSelect = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.ColorSelect'); colorSelect.setColorValues([ 'ff0000', '00ff00', '0000ff', ['ff0000', '00ff00', '0000ff'], ['1b9e77','d95f02','7570b3','e7298a','66a61e','e6ab02'], ['ffffb2','fed976','feb24c','fd8d3c','f03b20','bd0026'] ]); ``` Sets handler for color selection. Handler gives the selected color index. ```javascript colorSelect.setHandler(function(selected){ console.log('Selected index: ' + selected); }); ``` Change color select visualization. ```javascript colorSelect.setUIColors({ hover: 'FF0000', // menu hover background color selected: '00FF00', // selected background color menu: '0000FF' // menu background color }); ``` Select wanted color index. ```javascript colorSelect.setValue(0); ``` Inserts the button to given element. ```javascript var myUI = jQuery('div.mybundle.colorselect'); colorSelect.insertTo(myUI); ``` Removes the color select. ```javascript colorSelect.destroy(); ``` ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked on the page Used to create the component UI from begin to end

# Form & FormInput ## Description A Form is a passive container for zero or more FormInputs. It can trigger validation of all contained FormInputs and display and clear any errors reported by the FI's. A FormInput is a smart wrapper for an input, capable of, for example, validating values with regexp, reporting errors and triggering functions on events like keypresses and focus changes. ## Screenshot ![screenshot](form.png) ## Usage ### Simple one-field form ```javascript var form = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.Form'); var anInput = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.FormInput', 'input'); anInput.setPlaceholder('Placeholder text'); anInput.setRequired(true, 'Required field'); anInput.setContentCheck(true, 'Input contains illegal characters'); anInput.bindEnterKey(someInputHandler); form.addField(anInput); someElement.append(form.getForm()); ``` ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked on the page Used to create the component UI from begin to end

# Overlay ## Description The overlay component is defined in divmanazer bundle and provides masking functionality that prevents clicking on something behind the mask. ## TODO * Loadmask message ## How to use Masks the body element and resizes the mask if overlayd elements size changes. `followResizing()` with true parameter uses the browser windows resize event to modify size (doesn't monitor the given elements size change, only window size change). ```javascript var overlay = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.Overlay'); overlay.overlay('body'); overlay.followResizing(true); ``` Close the overlay after some operation by keeping reference to the overlay component and call `close()`. ```javascript overlay.close(); ``` Masks an element with id "myComponent". ```javascript var overlay = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.Overlay'); overlay.overlay('#myComponent'); ``` Masks an element with id "myComponent". The overlay will detect if the target element size changes and resize itself (`followResizing()`). With `bindClickToClose()` the overlay can be closed by clicking on it. ```javascript var overlay = Oskari.clazz.create('Oskari.userinterface.component.Overlay'); overlay.overlay('#myComponent'); overlay.followResizing(); overlay.bindClickToClose(); ``` ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked on the page Used to create the component UI from begin to end

divmanazer.desc: Manages menutiles, flyouts and other UI related funtionalities for other bundles to use. Also provides UI components. The tiles are rendered to a HTML element with id "menubar". The bundle doesn't create it but assumes it exists on the page.

event.name: UIChangeEvent
event.desc: Notifies major UI changes where some functionalities should clean up/shutdown their own UI.

event.name: userinterface.ExtensionUpdatedEvent
event.desc: Sent after Extension view state has changed

request.name: userinterface.AddExtensionRequest
request.desc: Extends the basic UI view

request.name: userinterface.ModalDialogRequest
request.desc: Request for UI modal dialog

request.name: userinterface.RemoveExtensionRequest
request.desc: Unregisters the extensions when the bundle gets stopped

request.name: userinterface.UpdateExtensionRequest
request.desc: Updates the extended UI view

guidedtour.name: guidedtour
guidedtour.desc: Shows a series of dialogs on startup to instruct user on map functionalities. The content of the dialogs is supplied from the bundles that the guided tour describes. Any bundle can register itself to the guided tour.

request.name: Guidedtour.AddToGuidedTourRequest
request.desc: Add guide to guided tour.

infobox.name: infobox
infobox.desc: Provides functionality for other bundles to show an infobox on the map. For example information about a search result. Defines a plugin for mapmodule that handles the infobox as an Openlayers popup with customized UI. Also extends jQuery by an outerHtml method. Templates are created with jQuery but Openlayers popup needs the actual HTML, this is where we need outerHtml.

event.name: InfoBox.InfoBoxEvent
event.desc: Used to notify that infobox has been closed.

event.name: InfoboxActionEvent
event.desc: Used to notify which link/button is clicked in the infobox.

request.name: InfoBox.HideInfoBoxRequest
request.desc: Hide infobox from the map.

request.name: InfoBox.RefreshInfoBoxRequest
request.desc: Refreshes the requested infobox/popup if present

request.name: InfoBox.ShowInfoBoxRequest
request.desc: Show infobox on map.

search.name: search
search.desc: Provides a generic and extensible search user-interface

event.name: Search.TabChangedEvent
event.desc: Notify metadatacatalogue that the tab has changed

request.name: Search.AddTabRequest
request.desc: Requests a tab to be added

request.name: Search.RemoveSearchResultActionRequest
request.desc: Requests a search result action to be removed

ui-components.name: ui-components
ui-components.desc: Imports user interface components from divmanazer (eg. Popup, Grid) to be used without initializing the divmanazer bundle. Used mostly in published map where the aforementioned bundle is not imported.

userguide.name: userguide
userguide.desc: Creates the Userguide flyout with title and content.

request.name: userguide.ShowUserGuideRequest
request.desc: Shows additional data in user guide

event.name: Toolbar.ToolbarLoadedEvent
event.desc: Used to notify components that the toolbar has been loaded and is available for tool button addition requests.

event.name: Toolbar.ToolSelectedEvent
event.desc: Used to notify components that a tool has been selected and components should cancel their tool related operations if any.

request.name: Toolbar.AddToolButtonRequest
request.desc: Requests for toolbar to add button with given config

request.name: Toolbar.RemoveToolButtonRequest
request.desc: Requests for toolbar to remove button with given id/group

request.name: Toolbar.SelectToolButtonRequest
request.desc: Requests for toolbar to act as if user had clicked a button or returns a default tool if create params aren't given.

request.name: Toolbar.ToolbarRequest
request.desc: Requests for toolbar to create/show/hide/remove a toolbar.

request.name: Toolbar.ToolButtonStateRequest
request.desc: Requests for toolbar to enable/disable a button.

analyse.name: analyse
analyse.desc: Bundle manages analyse parameter and data setups, requests analyse execute actions and stores analyse results to DB through backend action route.

coordinatedisplay.name: coordinatedisplay
coordinatedisplay.desc: This bundle provides a plugin (Oskari.mapframework.bundle.coordinatedisplay.plugin.CoordinatesPlugin) for mapmodule that shows coordinates on mouse location.

coordinatetool.name: coordinatetool
coordinatetool.desc: This bundle provides a plugin (Oskari.mapframework.bundle.coordinatetool.plugin.CoordinateToolPlugin) for mapmodule that can:

drawtools.name: drawtools
drawtools.desc: Allows user to draw feature geometries on map.

request.name: StartDrawingRequest
request.desc: Allows the user to draw on the map.

request.name: StopDrawingRequest
request.desc: Used to complete or clear the drawing.

event.name: DrawingEvent
event.desc: Notifies that sketch has been changed or drawing is finished.

backendstatus.name: backendstatus
backendstatus.desc: Polls a backend system for map layers monitoring statuses and informs interested parties via an event.

event.name: BackendStatus.BackendStatusChangedEvent
event.desc: Event is sent when the backend status of a map layer has changed.

featuredata.name: featuredata
featuredata.desc: The Bundle provides a grid view for vector layers' object data.

event.name: WFSSetFilter
event.desc: Notifies that a GeoJSON geometry filter has been set

event.name: WFSSetPropertyFilter
event.desc: Notifies that a WFS feature properties filter has been set

request.name: ShowFeatureDataRequest
request.desc: Requests a WFS feature data to be shown

feedbackService.name: feedbackService
feedbackService.desc: Provides a Oskari request/event API for listing and posting feedback to Open311-based service. Requires server-side functionality from oskari-server and configuration for the view/app on the server. Configuration fields are provided in the publisher tool.

event.name: FeedbackResultEvent
event.desc: Notifies that feedback request response has been got from the service. Includes the response data.

request.name: GetFeedbackRequest
request.desc: Get feedbacks from feedback service (Open311).

request.name: GetFeedbackServiceRequest
request.desc: Get feedback service list or metadata of single service (if id is given) from feedback service (Open311).

request.name: PostFeedbackRequest
request.desc: Posts user's feedback data to feedback service (Open311).

findbycoordinates.name: findbycoordinates
findbycoordinates.desc: Creates a service and a user interface for searching nearest address on a map and adds a button to the toolbar for reverse geocode search. Requires server side functionality.

geometrycutter.name: geometrycutter
geometrycutter.desc: The bundle provides tools for geometry editing. Currently supported functionality includes spliting Polygon or LineString with user drawn LineString and clipping any geometry with user drawn Polygon.

event.name: GeometryCuttingEvent
event.desc: Sent when any of the following happens:

request.name: StartGeometryCuttingRequest
request.desc: Starts cutting the supplied feature as target.

request.name: StopGeometryCuttingRequest
request.desc: Stops cutting.

heatmap.name: heatmap
heatmap.desc: Adds heatmap functionality to layers configured to support it (WMS-layers only at the moment). Configuration is done by adding the following information to a layers JSON:

mapanalysis.name: mapanalysis
mapanalysis.desc: Adds support for analysis layers. The analysisLayerPlugin needs to be registered for the map in order to visualize analysis layers

mapfull.name: mapfull
mapfull.desc: Initializes Oskari core with Oskari.mapframework.service.MapLayerService, starts up Oskari.mapframework.ui.module.common.MapModule and renders the map to a HTML element with id "mapdiv".

mapmodule.name: mapmodule

subFiles.fileContent:
# Background Layer Selection Plugin ## Description This plugin provides a background maplayer selection "dropdown" on top of the map. ## Screenshot ## Closed ![closed](images/backgroundlayerselection_closed.png) ## Open ![open](images/backgroundlayerselection_open.png) ## List ![list](images/backgroundlayerselection_list.png) ## Bundle configuration ```javascript { "baseLayers" : ["","","""], "showAsDropdown" : } ``` Configuration is required to define the preset background layers. UI can be presented as a button bar or a dropdown, this is controlled with `showAsDropdown`, which defaults to false. The font and colour scheme of the plugin are configurable, with variables `font` (String) and `colorScheme` (Object) respectively. A CSS class of `oskari-publisher-font-` is expected to be defined with font-family definition. The `colorScheme` object should have keys `buttonColor`, `buttonBackgroundColor`, `buttonSelectedColor`, `buttonSelectedBackgroundColor` and `buttonBorderColor`. ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out
RequestWhy/when
MapModulePlugin.RemoveMapLayerRequest Remove old background layer selection
MapModulePlugin.AddMapLayerRequest Add new background layer selection
MapModulePlugin.RearrangeSelectedMapLayerRequest Move bg layer to bottom
## Events the plugin listens to
EventWhy/when
Oskari.mapframework.event.common.AfterRearrangeSelectedMapLayerEvent Update selection, bottom baselayer might've changed
Oskari.mapframework.event.common.AfterMapLayerRemoveEvent Redo ui, one of the preset bg layers might've been deleted
Oskari.mapframework.event.common.AfterMapLayerAddEvent Redo ui, we might've gotten a previously missing preset bg layer
Oskari.mapframework.event.common.MapLayerEvent Redo ui, we might've gotten a previously missing preset bg layer
## Events the plugin sends out This bundle doesn't send any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked (on page locally in portal) Used to create the UI

# Controls Plugin ## Description ControlsPlugin adds zoombox, measure, keyboard and mouse controls to the map. ## Bundle configuration Map controls are configurable - setting the control values as false the control is not added. All controls are added by default if not explicitly configured. ```javascript { "conf": { "zoomBox" : false, "measureControls" : false, "keyboardControls" : false, "mouseControls" : false } } ``` ## Bundle state No statehandling has been implemented. ## Requests the bundle handles
RequestHow does the bundle react
ToolSelectionRequestActivates requested control
EnableMapKeyboardMovementRequestEnables keyboard movement (if it isn't configured otherwise)
DisableMapKeyboardMovementRequestDisables keyboard movement
EnableMapMouseMovementRequestEnables mouse movement (if it isn't configured otherwise)
DisableMapMouseMovementRequestDisables mouse movement
## Requests the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send out any requests. ## Events the bundle listens to
EventHow does the bundle react
Toolbar.ToolSelectedEventDisables zoom/measure controls
## Events the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send out any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[Oskari mapmodule](/documentation/bundles/framework/mapmodule) Expects to be present in application setup Controls will be added to map module

# Data Source Plugin
API[link here](/api/latest/classes/Oskari.mapframework.bundle.mapmodule.plugin.DataSourcePlugin.html)
## Description Renders a pop-up that contains a list of data providers based on selected layers. ## Screenshot ![screenshot](images/datasource.png) ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. ## Bundle state No statehandling has been implemented. ## Requests the bundle handles This bundle doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send out any requests. ## Events the bundle listens to
EventHow does the bundle react
openDialogOpens up pop-up
getMetadataInfoCallbackshows metadata associated with the layer
## Events the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send out any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked on the page Used to create the UI and to sort the layers
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses OpenLayers' popup

# Geo Location Plugin ## Description The plugin tries to locate the user with HTML5 GeoLocation or if that is not available, checks if the javascript methods provided by http://dev.maxmind.com/geoip/javascript are present and uses them if available. If location is successfully determined, centers the map on the location and zoom level 6. The HTML5 geolocation is parametrized to allow for max. one hour cached result and a timeout of 6 seconds. ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out This plugin doesn't sends any requests. ## Events the plugin listens to This plugin doesn't listen to any events. ## Events the plugin sends out This bundle doesn't send any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses mapmodule to transform geolocation coordinates from "EPSG:4326" to maps current projection

# Get Info Plugin ## Description This plugin provides view of the from GetFeatureInfo and similar results what are processed in backend ## Screenshot ![screenshot](images/gfi_query.png) ## Bundle configuration Handling infoBox and ignoredLayerTypes in the plugin are made configurable. infoBox variable makes it possible to request infoBox with additional information later on. ignoredLayerTypes is an array of layer types that are ignored in the requests. This functionality is made because of new mapwfs2 which controls WFS's GFI data. The colour scheme and font of the plugin are configurable, with variables `colourScheme` (Object) and `font` (String), respectively. A CSS class of `oskari-publisher-font-` is expected to be defined with font-family definition. The structure of `colourScheme` should be of following format: ```javascript { "val": "", "bgColour": "", "titleColour": "", "headerColour": "", "iconCls": "" } ``` ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out This plugin doesn't sends out any requests ## Events the bundle listens to
Event How does the bundle react
EscPressedEvent Closing GetInfo "popup" from screen.
MapClickedEvent Send ajax request to backend system.
AfterMapMoveEvent Cancel ajax request.
## Events the plugin sends out
EventWhy/when
GetInfoResultEvent Result of ajax request formatted send as an event so that infobox handling can be done elsewhere
## Dependencies
Dependency Linked from Purpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked (on page locally in portal) Used to create the UI
[Oskari infobox](/documentation/bundles/framework/infobox) Oskari's InfoBoxBundle That handles the infobox as an Openlayers popup with customized UI
[Backend API](/documentation/backend/mapmodule/getinfoplugin) N/A Get info is handle in backend

# Index Map Plugin ## Description This plugin adds an indexmap for the map it is registered to. ## Screenshot ![closed](images/indexmap_closed.png) Closed ![open](images/indexmap_open.png) Open ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required, in which case the indexmap appears on the lower right corner of the map by default. If there are many elements in the same location, variable 'position' defines the order of the elements. If you wish to change the location of the indexmap, you have two possibilities: 1) Define location on a map by configuring variables 'classes' and 'position'. Below are the default values. ```javascript { "location" : { "classes" : "bottom right", "position" : 5 } }; ``` 2) Define container for the indexmap by configuring containerId. ```javascript { "containerId" = "mycontainerId" } ``` ### Button icon By default the button that open the indexmap has an icon with the map of the world. If you want to change this icon, you can override the background with the selector: ```css .indexmapToggle div.icon { background-image: url('path/to/icon') !important; } ``` ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out This plugin doesn't sends any requests. ## Events the plugin listens to
Event How does the bundle react
AfterMapMoveEvent Updates ui to current map location
## Events the plugin sends out
Event Why/When
AfterMapMoveEvent After map has moved within the indexmap
## Dependencies
Dependency Linked from Purpose
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses OpenLayers.Control.OverviewMap to render the index map.

# Layer Selection Plugin ## Description This plugin provides a maplayer selection "dropdown" on top of the map. ## Screenshot ![open](images/layerselection_open.png) ## Bundle configuration ```javascript { baseLayers : ['','',''], defaultBaseLayer : '', isStyleSelectable: } ``` Configuration is not required, but it can be used to set some selected layers as "base layers". Baselayers differ from normal layers that only one base layer is shown at a time. Setting `isStyleSelectable` to true will allow the user to change the style of map layers that have more than one style. This flag can be set in the publisher tool for layer selection. The styling, font and colour scheme of the plugin are configurable, with variables `toolStyle` (String), `font` (String) and `colourScheme` (Object) respectively. A CSS class of `oskari-publisher-font-` is expected to be defined with font-family definition. Following values are supported for the `toolStyle`: `rounded-light`, `rounded-dark`, `sharp-dark`, `sharp-light`, `3d-dark` and `3d-light`. An image `map-layer-button-.png` is expected to be found in plugin's image resources directory. The `colourScheme` object should have keys `bgColour`, `titleColour` and `iconCls`. ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out
RequestWhy/when
MapModulePlugin.MapLayerVisibilityRequest Controls map layer selection by hiding map layers and making them visible on the map
## Events the plugin listens to This plugin doesn't listen any events. ## Events the plugin sends out This bundle doesn't send any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked (on page locally in portal) Used to create the UI

# Layers Plugin ## Description This is a plugin to bring more functionality for the mapmodules map implementation. It provides handling for rearranging layer order and controlling layer visibility. Provides information to other bundles if a layer becomes visible/invisible (out of scale/out of content geometry) and request handlers to move map to location/scale based on layer content. Also optimizes openlayers maplayers visibility setting if it detects that content is not in the viewport. ## TODO Has some handling for the markers layer. IMHO shouldn't. ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. ## Bundle state No statehandling has been implemented for this. ## Requests the bundle handles
Request How does the bundle react
MapModulePlugin.MapLayerVisibilityRequest Hides a maplayer or changes a hidden layer to visible.
MapModulePlugin.MapMoveByLayerContentRequest Moves the map to a location and/or scale where the maplayer has content. (Maplayer geometry is visible in viewport/scale is in range for layer).
## Requests the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send any requests. ## Events the bundle listens to
Event How does the bundle react
AfterRearrangeSelectedMapLayerEvent Moves the Openlayers maplayers order to match the layer move spesified in the event, also handles markers layer that it would stay on top
MapMoveStartEvent Stops internal timer scheduled to do a visibility check.
AfterMapMoveEvent Schedules a visibility check to be done with a small delay (delay to improve performance on concurrent moves)
AfterMapLayerAddEvent Checks if added layer has geometries. If not, checks if it has geometryWKT (well-known text) value. If WKT is available, parses it to fill in the geometry array.
## Events the bundle sends out
Event When it is triggered/what it tells other components
MapLayerVisibilityChangedEvent Notifies other bundles if a layer has become visible/invisible telling if its out of scale or content area.
## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses Openlayers to parse WKT geometry, detect if it matches to current maps viewport and to get the centerpoint for layers geometry. Also controls Openlayers to show/hide layers.

# Markers Plugin ## Description The plugin offers Marker functionality for the map. Adding, removing markers and event when a marker has been added or clicked. Also adds a button to toolbar for adding markers. ## TODO * marker placeholders are much bigger than actual markers. Clicks are registered on placeholder so the click area is too large. ## Screenshot ![screenshot](images/mapmodule-markerplugin.png) ## Plugin configuration No configuration is required. Following is optional: ```javascript { markerButton : false } ``` A toolbar button is added to toolbar by default (if toolbar bundle is present). Config can be used to prevent this. ## Plugin state Markers on map are saved in state: ```javascript { "markers" : [ { "color":"ffde00", "shape":2, "msg":"user input", "y":7212755, "x":427491, "size":1 } ] } ``` ## Requests the plugin handles
RequestHow does the bundle react
[MapModulePlugin.AddMarkerRequest](/documentation/requests/addmarkerrequest)Adds or modifies marker on the map
[MapModulePlugin.RemoveMarkersRequest](/documentation/requests/removemarkersrequest)Removes one or all markers from map
## Requests the plugin sends out
RequestWhy/when
Toolbar.AddToolButtonRequest Adds a toolbar button for activating marker tool.
MapModulePlugin.GetFeatureInfoActivationRequest Disable GFI while adding a marker.
WfsLayerPlugin.ActivateHighlightRequest Disable feature highlighting while adding a marker.
Toolbar.SelectToolButtonRequest Reset toolbar to default tool after marker has been added.
## Events the plugin listens to
Event How does the bundle react
MapClickedEvent When marker tool is activated, adds the marker to the spot indicated by the event.
Toolbar.ToolbarLoadedEvent Registers the toolbar button if toolbar wasn't available on startup.
SearchClearedEvent Removes all markers.
AfterRearrangeSelectedMapLayerEvent Raises the markers layer to top so markers aren't lost behind another map layer.
## Events the plugin sends out
EventWhy/when
AfterAddMarkerEvent Notifies that a marker has been added and provides an ID for the marker.
AfterRemoveMarkersEvent Notifies that a marker has been removed. If event has a marker ID a single marker was removed, otherwise all markers were cleared
MarkerClickEvent Notifies that a marker has been clicked. Provides the ID of the clicked marker.
## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked Used to create the UI
[Raphael](http://raphaeljs.com/) Version 2.1.2 assumed to be linked Used to create SVG icons
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses OpenLayers.Layer.Vector for marker layer and OpenLayers.Feature.Vector for markers.

# My Location Plugin ## Description The plugin offers the user a center map a his geolocation. ## Screenshot ![screenshot](images/mylocationplugin.png) ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. The following configuration options are optional: ```javascript { "zoom" : 11, "mode": "single", "centerMapAutomatically": true, "mobileOnly": true } ``` Configurable options: * zoom: configure zoom level that is used when zoomed to user location (otherwise zoomed based on accuracy) * mode: "single" or "continuous". * Single mode: moves map to user location when used. * Continuous mode: Show user location on the map with accuracy circle and follow the user continuously. If user location is outside the map viewport then map is centered on user location. * centerMapAutomatically: `true` or `false`. When `true` map is centered to user location automatically on startup. * mobileOnly: `true` or `false`. Restrict functionality to mobile devices. When `true` the `centerMapAutomatically` and `mode` are ignored and the UI is not shown on desktop devices. Default configuration: { "mode: "single", "centerMapAutomatically": false } ## Requests the plugin handles
RequestHow does the bundle react
[MyLocationPlugin.GetUserLocationRequest](/documentation/requests/getuserlocationrequest) Gets user geolocation
## Requests the plugin sends out
RequestWhere/why it's used
StartUserLocationTrackingRequestStart user tracking
StopUserLocationTrackingRequestStop user tracking
## Events the plugin listens to This bundle doesn't listen to any events. ## Events the plugin sends out
EventWhy/when
[UserLocationEvent](/documentation/events/userlocationevent) Sends the event when getted user geolocation.
## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked Used to create the UI

# Pan Buttons Plugin ## Description The plugin offers the user a move my by pan buttons ## TODO * image url config (can be used by mapmodule image path [getImageUrl()]) ## Screenshot ![screenshot](images/panbuttons.png) ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. Following is optional: The styling and font of the plugin are configurable, with variables `toolStyle` (String) and `font` (String), respectively. A CSS class of `oskari-publisher-font-` is expected to be defined with font-family definition. Following values are supported for the `toolStyle`: `rounded-light`, `rounded-dark`, `sharp-dark`, `sharp-light`, `3d-dark` and `3d-light`. An image `panbutton-sprites-.png` is expected to be found in plugin's image resources directory. ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out This plugin doesn't sends any requests. ## Events the plugin listens to This bundle doesn't listen to any events. ## Events the plugin sends out This bundle doesn't send any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked Used to create the UI

# Portti2 Zoombar Plugin ## Description The plugin offers the user a zoom control for the map. Gets the initial zoom level from the map it is registered to when started. ## TODO * Tooltips ## Screenshot ![screenshot](images/zoombar.png) ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required, but optionally location can be overridden by giving: ```javascript { location : { top : '10px', left : '10px' } } ``` Bottom and right can also be used. The styling and font of the plugin are configurable, with variables `toolStyle` (Object) and `font` (String), respectively. A CSS class of `oskari-publisher-font-` is expected to be defined with font-family definition. Following styles are supported for the `toolStyle.val`: `rounded-light`, `rounded-dark`, `sharp-dark`, `sharp-light`, `3d-dark` and `3d-light`. Images `zoombar-.png`, `zoombar-cursor-.png`, `zoombar_minus-.png` and `zoombar_minus-.png` are expected to be found in plugin's image resources directory. Also, widths and heights should be configured following the example: ```javascript { val: 'rounded-dark', // The id of the style. widthPlus: '22px', // Width of the 'plus' image. widthMinus: '22px', // Width of the 'minus' image. widthCenter: '22px', // Width of the 'center' image. heightPlus: '38px', // Height of the 'plus' image. heightMinus: '39px', // Height of the 'minus' image. heightCenter: 12, // Height of the 'center' image. NOTE! an integer. heightCursor: '18px', // Height of the 'cursor' image. widthCursor: '17px' // Width of the 'cursor' image. } ``` ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out This plugin doesn't sends any requests. ## Events the plugin listens to || Event || How does the bundle react || || AfterMapMoveEvent || Zoom to in or out \\ || ## Events the plugin sends out This bundle doesn't send any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked Used to create the UI
[RightJS slider](http://rightjs.org/ui/slider) https://github.com/nls-oskari/oskari/blob/master/libraries/rightjs/javascripts/right/slider.js RightJS UI component for slider - used to show zoombar

# PublishedToolbar Plugin ## Description This is a plugin to bring toolbar functionality to published maps. It provides a container for the toolbar bundle to add itself into and available buttons allowing publishable maps to be configured to include only the wanted tools. The toolbar bundle handles most requests, except "Toolbar.ToolContainerRequest", which are handled by publishertoolbar. ## Bundle configuration ```javascript { "toolbarId" : "PublisherToolbar" } ``` No configuration is required. If the toolbarId is defined, then publishertoolbar creates a new toolbar using the given id into itself. This is particularily useful when configuring a published map. ## Bundle state No statehandling has been implemented for this. ## Requests the bundle handles
Request How does the bundle react
MapModulePlugin.MapLayerVisibilityRequest Hides a maplayer or changes a hidden layer to visible.
MapModulePlugin.MapMoveByLayerContentRequest Moves the map to a location and/or scale where the maplayer has content. (Maplayer geometry is visible in viewport/scale is in range for layer).
## Requests the bundle handles
RequestHow does the bundle react
Toolbar.ToolContainerRequest Creates and removes popup content containers within the plugin container provided by publishertoolbar
## Requests the bundle sends out
RequestWhy/when
Toolbar.ToolbarRequest Adds a toolbar into the published map.
## Events the bundle listens to This bundle doesn't listen to any events. ## Events the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses Openlayers to parse WKT geometry, detect if it matches to current maps viewport and to get the centerpoint for layers geometry. Also controls Openlayers to show/hide layers.
[Oskari toolbar](/documentation/bundles/framework/toolbar) Oskari's ToolbarBundle That handles the toolbar functionality

# Scale Bar Plugin ## Description The plugin adds a scale bar to the map it is registered to. ## Screenshot ![screenshot](images/scalebar.png) ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. ## Requests the plugin handles This plugin doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the plugin sends out This plugin doesn't sends any requests. ## Events the plugin listens to
EventHow does the bundle react
AfterMapMoveEventUpdates ui to current zoom level
## Events the plugin sends out This bundle doesn't send any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses OpenLayers.Control.ScaleLine to render the scalebar.

# Search Plugin ## Description Creates a search field for places in published maps. ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. Following is optional: The styling and font of the plugin are configurable, with variables `toolStyle` (Object) and `font` (String), respectively. A CSS class of `oskari-publisher-font-` is expected to be defined with font-family definition. Following styles are supported for the `toolStyle.val`: `rounded-light`, `rounded-dark`, `sharp-dark`, `sharp-light`, `3d-dark` and `3d-light`. Images for search field background are expected to be found in plugin's image resources directory for left, middle and right sides of the field: `search-tool-_01.png`, `search-tool-_02.png` and `search-tool-_03.png`, respectively. Also, the widths of the images are expected to be defined in config object: ```javascript { val: 'rounded-dark', // The id of the style. widthLeft: '17px', // Width of the left side image. widthRight: '32px' // Width of the right side image. } ``` ## Bundle state No statehandling has been implemented. ## Requests the bundle handles This bundle doesn't handle any requests. ## Requests the bundle sends out
RequestWhy/when
DisableMapKeyboardMovementRequest Disables the map movement when entering text to the search field.
EnableMapKeyboardMovementRequest Enables the map movement when the search field blurs again.
MapMoveRequest Moves the map to a location in the results table received from the search service.
## Events the bundle listens to This bundle doesn't listen to any events. ## Events the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send out any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked (on page locally in portal) Used to create the UI and to sort the layers
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Uses OpenLayers' popup
Oskari.mapframework.bundle.search.service.SearchService Expects to be present in application setup Sends the search request trough the service

# Vector Layer Plugin ## Description Provides functionality to draw vector layers on the map. ## Bundle configuration No configuration is required. Following is optional: ```javascript { "layers": [ { "id": "EXAMPLE1", "style": { "fill": { "color": "#ff00ff" }, "stroke": { "color": "#ff00ff", "width": 3 }, "text": { "fill": { "color": "#0000ff" }, "stroke": { "color": "#ff00ff", "width": 4 } } } } ] } ``` This configuration creates one (or many) layer(s) when plugin is started. You can tell layer default style for style object. When feature added layer style is used if feature request not contains feature style. If layer and feature style is not defined using defaults. ## Bundle state No statehandling has been implemented. ## Requests the bundle handles
RequestHow does the bundle react
MapModulePlugin.AddFeaturesToMapRequestAdd features on the map
MapModulePlugin.RemoveFeaturesFromMapRequestRemoves features from map
## Requests the bundle sends out This plugin doesn't sends any requests. ## Events the bundle listens to
Event How does the bundle react
AfterMapLayerRemoveEvent Remove OpenLayer's layer from map.
AfterChangeMapLayerOpacityEvent Update OpenLayer's layer opacity.
## Events the bundle sends out This bundle doesn't send out any events. ## Dependencies
DependencyLinked fromPurpose
[jQuery](http://api.jquery.com/) Version 1.7.1 assumed to be linked (on page locally in portal) Used to create the UI and to sort the layers
[OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org/) not linked, assumes its linked by map Used to create the vector layer.

mapmodule.desc: Provides abstraction for map implementation (Openlayers 2/3) and provides a plugin mechanism to add additional functionality to map.

event.name: AfterAddMarkerEvent
event.desc: Notifies that marker has been added to the map.

event.name: AfterMapMoveEvent
event.desc: Notifies that map has been moved or zoomed.

event.name: AfterRemoveMarkersEvent
event.desc: Event is sent after map markers are removed

event.name: DataForMapLocationEvent
event.desc: Notifies application that a click on the map resulted in more data for that location (GFI style content).

event.name: EscPressedEvent
event.desc: Event is sent when ESC key in keyboard is pressed so bundles can react to it.

event.name: FeatureEvent
event.desc: Used to notify about add, remove, update and click events for features.

event.name: GetInfoResultEvent
event.desc: Update map click information coming from ajax request

event.name: LayerToolsEditModeEvent
event.desc: Event sent when user edits layout order

event.name: map.layer.activation
event.desc: Triggered when a layer has activated/deactivated.

event.name: MapClickedEvent
event.desc: Notifies user that map has been clicked.

event.name: MapLayerVisibilityChangedEvent
event.desc:
This is used to notify that layers visibility has changed. Either the map has
moved out of the layers scale range or the layers geometry is no longer in the maps viewport.
Listeners should also check getMapLayer().getVisible() method that indicates if the map has been hidden by the user.

event.name: MapSizeChangedEvent
event.desc: Event is sent when the map div size is changed

event.name: MapTourEvent
event.desc: Notifies status of MapTourRequest

event.name: MarkerClickEvent
event.desc: Notifies that map marker has been clicked.

event.name: MouseHoverEvent
event.desc: Notifies user about the pointer moves.

event.name: ProgressEvent
event.desc: An event that tells if something is progressing or is it done (layers loading / layers done loading)

event.name: TimeChangedEvent
event.desc: Notifies of changed time

event.name: UserLocationEvent
event.desc: Notifies user location.

request.name: AddFeaturesToMapRequest
request.desc: Allows user to add features to map.

request.name: AddMapLayerRequest
request.desc: Adds a layer to the map.

request.name: AddMarkerRequest
request.desc: Add marker to certain point on map.

request.name: ChangeMapLayerOpacityRequest
request.desc: Allows user to change map layer opacity on a map.

request.name: ChangeMapLayerStyleRequest
request.desc: Allow user to change map layer style between preconfigured options on the map (styles available for a WMS-layer etc).

request.name: DisableMapKeyboardMovementRequest
request.desc: Disable map keyboard movement.

request.name: DisableMapMouseMovementRequest
request.desc: Disable map mouse movement.

request.name: EnableMapKeyboardMovementRequest
request.desc: Enable map keyboard movement.

request.name: EnableMapMouseMovementRequest
request.desc: Enable map mouse movement.

request.name: GetFeatureInfoRequest
request.desc: Display feature info box.

request.name: GetUserLocationRequest
request.desc: Get user's location

request.name: map.layer.activation
request.desc: Flags the layer as activated/deactivated.

request.name: MapModulePlugin.MapLayerUpdateRequest
request.desc: Update the map layer data on map.

request.name: MapModulePlugin.MapLayerVisibilityRequest
request.desc: Allows user to change map layer visibility.

request.name: MapModulePlugin.MapMoveByLayerContentRequest
request.desc: Allows the user to move the map by the layer content.

request.name: MapModulePlugin.RegisterStyleRequest
request.desc: Allows user to add wellknown svg styles.

request.name: MapMoveRequest
request.desc: Allows user to move the map to certain location.

request.name: MapTourRequest
request.desc: Allows programmatic tour around the map showcasing multiple locations

request.name: MapModulePlugin.MarkerVisibilityRequest
request.desc: Show or hide marker from map.

request.name: RearrangeSelectedMapLayerRequest
request.desc: Allow user to change order of map layers in relation to other layers on the map.

request.name: RemoveFeaturesFromMapRequest
request.desc: Remove vector features from map

request.name: RemoveMapLayerRequest
request.desc: Removes a map layer from map.

request.name: RemoveMarkersRequest
request.desc: Remove markers from the map.

request.name: SetTimeRequest
request.desc: Allows programmatic change of time for 3d map

request.name: ShowProgressSpinnerRequest
request.desc: Allows progress spinner to be shown or hidden on a map.

request.name: StartUserLocationTrackingRequest
request.desc: Start tracking user's location.

request.name: StopUserLocationTrackingRequest
request.desc: Stop tracking user's location.

request.name: VectorLayerRequest
request.desc: Adds a new feature layer to map or updates an existing layer.

request.name: ZoomToFeaturesRequest
request.desc: Moves map to show referenced vector features on the viewport.

maplegend.name: maplegend
maplegend.desc: Displays legend images of selected map layers in a Flyout if the layers have legend image urls set.

mapmodule3d.name: mapmodule3d
mapmodule3d.desc: Ol Cesium implementation of the mapmodule bundle.

maprotator.name: maprotator
maprotator.desc: Provides functionality to rotate the map when the bundle is started. To rotate the map press SHIFT + ALT + Drag with mouse.

event.name: map.rotated
event.desc: Event which informs how many degrees the map has rotated.

request.name: rotate.map request
request.desc: Sets the map at a certain angle based on degrees.

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.desc: Deprecated. Provides UI to make selection on map.

metadatacatalogue.name: metadatacatalogue
metadatacatalogue.desc: Bundle provides metadata catalogue search functionality for the map.

event.name: MetaData.FinishedDrawingEvent
event.desc: Used to notify components that the drawing has been finished.

event.name: MetadataSearchResultEvent
event.desc: Notifies that a metadata search has been performed and the result is accessible through the event.

request.name: AddSearchResultActionRequest
request.desc: Shows action element in metadata search results list

request.name: MetadataSearchRequest
request.desc: Make a metadata search query.

metadataflyout.name: metadataflyout
metadataflyout.desc: Generic functionality to display metadata from a CSW-service

request.name: catalogue.AddTabRequest
request.desc: Requests tab to be added

request.name: catalogue.ShowMetadataRequest
request.desc: Request for showing metadata for the given uuid, layer id or RS_Identifier Code / RS_Identifier CodeSpace

event.name: MyPlaces.MyPlacesChangedEvent
event.desc: Tell components to reload myplaces data.

request.name: MyPlaces.DeleteCategoryRequest
request.desc: Requests a "my place" maplayer/category to be deleted

request.name: MyPlaces.DeletePlaceRequest
request.desc: Requests a saved "my place" to be deleted

request.name: MyPlaces.EditCategoryRequest
request.desc: Requests a "my place" maplayer/category to be opened for editing

request.name: MyPlaces.EditPlaceRequest
request.desc: Requests a saved "my place" to be opened for editing

request.name: MyPlaces.OpenAddLayerDialogRequest
request.desc: Requests the add layer dialog to be opened

request.name: MyPlaces.PublishCategoryRequest
request.desc: Requests a "my place" maplayer/category to be made publishable or private

myplacesimport.name: myplacesimport
myplacesimport.desc: This bundle allows the user to import and save their own datas.

printout.name: printout
printout.desc: Manages settings panel when user has entered to the print mode.

event.name: Printout.PrintableContentEvent
event.desc: Set data for print

event.name: Printout.PrintCanceledEvent
event.desc: Used to notify components that the basic printout is canceled

event.name: Printout.PrintWithoutUIEvent
event.desc: Print pdf/png with predefined params without UI

request.name: printout.PrintMapRequest
request.desc: Starts/opens the UI for printout functionality like user had clicked the tool icon.

publishedmyplaces2.name: publishedmyplaces2
publishedmyplaces2.desc:
My places functionality for a published map.
Editing is not included, only creation and the default layer needs to be created by other means. Initial implementation and further development follows.

postprocessor.name: postprocessor
postprocessor.desc: Moves the map viewport to location defined in config and requests a highlight for featureId (also from config).

routingService.name: routingService
routingService.desc: Provides a service which listen ``GetRouteRequest`` request. When request has made the service send ajax call to Oskari backend and waiting to response. When response come then service sends ``RouteResultEvent``.

event.name: RouteResultEvent
event.desc: Notifies that route has been got successfully from the service. Includes information about the route.

request.name: GetRouteRequest
request.desc: Get route plan between two points.

routingui.name: routingui
routingui.desc: This bundle provides UI for routing. In this bundle user can select start and end points of route and then search route of between these points. Finally results are showed on the popup.

userstyle.name: userstyle
userstyle.desc: Provides functionality to add runtime styles for layer.

request.name: ShowUserStylesRequest
request.desc: Requests a user own styles to be shown for specific layer.

wfsvector.name: wfsvector
wfsvector.desc:
WfsVectorLayerPlugin is an alternative implementation of mapwfs2 that uses MVT vector tiles or geojson as data transfer mechanism. 
Requires module `control-mvt` to be in use in the backend. Currently supports functionalities:

request.name: WfsLayerPlugin.ActivateHighlightRequest
request.desc: Requests a WFS highlight enabled or disabled

event.name: WFSFeatureEvent
event.desc: Notifies about received WFS feature properties data

event.name: WFSFeaturesSelectedEvent
event.desc: Used to indicate that a WFS Feature has been selected and components should highlight it in UI

event.name: WFSPropertiesEvent
event.desc: Notifies about WFS feature properties field names
